newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's NSW 96/97 budget on track for surplus.
newsitem.headline: Australia's NSW 96/97 budget on track for surplus.

text.p: The Australian state of New South Wales remains on track for a small budget surprlus in 1996/97 (July-June), Treasurer Michael Egan said on Wednesday, after issuing the State's financial statement for the eight months to February 1997.
The state reported an underlying deficit of A$79 million for the NSW Budget Sector for the eight months compared to a surplus of A$101 million for the same period in 1995/96.
The headline deficit stood at A$119 million for the eight month period against a surplus of A$80 million in 1995/96.
